boardgame.name: Pax Renaissance
boardgame.description: As a Renaissance banker, you will finance kings or republics, sponsor voyages of discovery, join secret cabals, or unleash jihads and inquisitions. Your choices determine whether Europe is elevated into the bright modern era or remains festering in dark feudalism._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In Pax Renaissance, you have two actions each turn. As in other Pax games, you can acquire cards in a market, sell them out of the game, or play them into your tableau. You can also stimulate the economy by running trade fairs and trading voyages for Oriental goods. A map of Europe with trade routes from Portugal to Crimea is included, and discovering new trade routes can radically alter the importance and wealth of empires, ten of which are in the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Four victories determine the future course of Western Society: Will it be towards imperialism, trade globalization, religious totalitarianism, or enlightened art and science?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 130 The Good, the Board, and the Existential Question
Episode 9: Phil Eklund_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Adventures In Cube Repression
The Game Pit: Episode 87 - Review of 2016 including Top 5s
The Good The Board and The Heavy: Episode 117 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Heavy Con Breakdown_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

The latest in the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;Pax_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; series applies the game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s mechanisms to the Renaissance period. The players are the major European bankers, financing governments, the church, explorations and, of course, great art. The players_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; choices will determine how Europe enters the modern era. This is my new must-play game. The price shown is for UK/EU purchasers (and includes VAT). For purchasers outside the EU, the price is £22.50 (net of UK tax) - note that the purchaser is responsible for paying any duty or tax due on import to their country. I charge shipping at cost, as follows. UK addresses: £2.75 (myHermes, takes 2-3 working days, tracked) Other EU countries: £6.95 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Europe outside the EU: £8.34 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Australasia: £11.25 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) USA, Canada _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; elsewhere: £10.40 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked)

Parting with a spare NEW IN SHRINK copy to make room for new games. I have played my personal copy close to twenty times and consider it a staple game in my collection. Always an enjoyable experience. Grab a copy before it goes out of print. I have been a BGG member for years, but only sold once on BGG. You can see my buyer/seller feedback on ebay, seller ID _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;houlie63_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. Buyer pays exact shipping based on location. Your game will be carefully packaged and sent via USPS priority mail. This method includes tracking information so you can track progress to your destination. Reach out to me if you require a different shipping method. Please reach out with any questions prior to purchase. Thanks for looking.

Pick up the game at my game store (no shipping cost) Shipping: always insured and with tracking Germany: 5,99€ for the first item card games or smaller boxes might be cheaper (please contact me beforehand) EU: 13,99€ up to 2kg 15,99€ up to 5kg 20,99€ up to 10kg Rest of the world: Please contact me before purchasing an item to clarify the shipping costs. Please contact frank@spieleberatung.com and I will attempt to resolve the matter. Unopened copies of the game that are no longer wanted can be returned, but there is a 10% restocking fee payable of the item price and the buyer is responsible for the return shipping costs.
